data.name: Hitmontop

attacks.name: Detect
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Hitmontop.

attacks.name: Triple Kick
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: If you become enchanted by its smooth, elegant, dancelike kicks, you may get drilled hard.

data.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

data.name: Infernape

attacks.name: Rushing Flames
attacks.text: Discard as many Fire Energy cards as you like attached to your Pokémon in play. Flip a coin for each Energy card you discarded. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Infernape.

data.flavorText: It uses unique fighting moves with fires on its hands and feet. It will take on any opponent.

data.name: Slugma

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its body is made of magma. If it doesn't keep moving, its body will cool and harden.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

abilities.name: Undevelop
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Jolteon and put Jolteon into your hand. This power can't be used if Jolteon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Evolving Thunder
attacks.text: If Jolteon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

data.name: Helioptile

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

data.name: Wailord

attacks.name: Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Open Sea
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Water Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Wailord pursue their prey in pods. With their large mouths, they can swallow entire schools of Wishiwashi whole.

data.name: Blaziken-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Explosive Kick
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blaze Out-GX
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If Sharpedo is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Sharpedo is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dark Slash
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Sharpedo. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Weezing

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Super Explosion
attacks.text: Weezing does 90 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness to this damage.

data.flavorText: If one of the twin Koffing inflates, the other one deflates. It constantly mixes its poisonous gases.

data.name: Tirtouga
rules: Put this card onto your Bench only with the effect of Cover Fossil
data.flavorText: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.

data.name: Rockruff

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.

data.name: Turtonator

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The shell on its back is chemically unstable and explodes violently if struck. The hole in its stomach is its weak point.

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Overwhelmed by enigmatic abilities, it suffers a constant headache. It sometimes uses mysterious powers.

data.name: Rolycoly
data.flavorText: Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.

data.name: Oshawott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

attacks.name: Aqua Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for Pokémon that has Team Aqua in its name, show up to 3 of them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Grass' Power
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rushing Water
attacks.text: Move an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

data.name: Serperior

abilities.name: Royal Heal
abilities.text: At any times between turns, heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

attacks.name: Ramming Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads or you may start again. Each time you start again, put 2 damage counters on Mamoswine. (If Mamoswine would be Knocked Out, you can't start again.)

attacks.name: Parade
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Swinub on your Bench, plus 20 more damage for each Piloswine on your Bench, and 40 more damage for each Mamoswine on your Bench.

data.name: Gloom

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.flavorText: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

data.name: Team Aqua's Sharpedo

abilities.name: Aqua Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Team Aqua Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It boasts fangs so powerful that they knock opponents out in one shot! Enemies that slip up will be taken down without fail!

data.name: Machamp

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 20 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.

abilities.name: Chlorophyll
abilities.text: All Energy cards that provide only Colorless Energy attached to your Grass Pokémon provide Grass Energy instead.

attacks.name: Green Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Toxic Sleep
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Nidoking

attacks.name: Poison Rub
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pride Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Nidoqueen on your Bench. This attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: One swing of its mighty tail can snap a telephone pole as if it were a matchstick.

attacks.name: Stamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage (to the Defending Pokémon) and 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If tails, this attack does 30 damage (to the Defending Pokémon).

abilities.name: Synergy Effect
abilities.text: If Phoebe's Stadium is in play, prevent all damage done to Sableye by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Down Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards from the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Self-control
abilities.text: Golbat can't be Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Golbat.

data.name: M Blastoise-EX
rules: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.
Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydro Bombard
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Lotad

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It looks like an aquatic plant and serves as a ferry to Pokémon that can't swim.

attacks.name: Aeroblast
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Invisible Wall
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power can't be used if Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.

data.name: Dark Arbok
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Swallow Up
attacks.text: Before doing damage, count the remaining HP of the Defending Pokémon and Dark Arbok. If the Defending Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than Dark Arbok's, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Extra Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.name: Heatran

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Raging Flare
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Do the Wave
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more for each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Dewott

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

data.name: Bayleef
data.flavorText: A spicy aroma emanates from around its neck. The aroma acts as a stimulant to restore health.

data.name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: String Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each basic Energy card attached to Exeggutor and to the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Nutritional Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to any of your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It is called "The Walking Jungle." If a head grows too big, it falls off and becomes an EXEGGCUTE.

attacks.name: Water Ring
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon that isn't Water on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dark Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Magnetic Lines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them. If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and attach that Energy card to it.

data.flavorText: The number of incidents of hackers using Magnetons to damage computer systems is steadily increasing.

data.name: Uxie

attacks.name: Psypower
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: When Uxie flew, people gained the ability to solve problems. It was the birth of knowledge.

data.name: Slowking

abilities.name: Second Sight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It has incredible intellect and intuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

data.name: Palkia

attacks.name: Spacial Rend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Stadium card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If there is any Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Transback
attacks.text: You may flip a coin. If heads, discard all Energy attached to Palkia and put the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it on top of your opponent's deck. Your opponent shuffles his or her deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

data.name: Heatran LV.X
rules: Put this card onto your Active Heatran. Heatran LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

abilities.name: Heat Metal
abilities.text: Your opponent can't remove the Special Condition Burned by evolving or devolving his or her Burned Pokémon. (This also includes putting a Pokémon Level-Up card onto the Burned Pokémon.) Whenever your opponent flips a coin for the Special Condition Burned between turns, treat it as tails.

abilities.name: Heat Wave
abilities.text: Once at the end of your turn, if Heatran is on your Bench, you may use this power. If you discarded basic Energy cards attached to your Fire or Metal Active Pokémon by using that Pokémon's attack this turn, attach up to 2 of those Energy cards to that Pokémon.

data.name: Leafeon

attacks.name: Sprial Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Leafeon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

data.name: Vanilluxe

attacks.name: ChillMAX
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Cold Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry, cause violent blizzards.

data.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Revenge Melody
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Kricketot and Kricketune in your discard pile.

attacks.name: Bug Buzz
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage. Remove the Special Condition Asleep from the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

data.name: Grapploct V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Tie Up
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, it can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Moonsault Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Scorbunny
data.flavorText: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.

data.name: Buzzwole

attacks.name: Sledgehammer
attacks.text: If your opponent has exactly 4 Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Swing Around
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

data.name: Medicham

attacks.name: Force Palm
attacks.text: Count the number of damage counters on Medicham. Put that many damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spinning Kick
attacks.text: Medicham does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Through yoga training, it has honed its sixth sense. Its movements are elegant.

data.name: Nidoqueen

attacks.name: Boyfriends
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Nidoking you have in play.

data.flavorText: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves.

data.name: Clawitzer

attacks.name: Standing By
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Sharpshooting attack does 120 damage instead of 40.

attacks.name: Sharpshooting
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

attacks.name: Knock Over
attacks.text: You may discard any Stadium card in play.

data.name: Jellicent

attacks.name: Vengeful Wish
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They propel themselves by expelling absorbed seawater from their bodies. Their favorite food is life energy.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

data.name: Lombre

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

data.name: Octillery

attacks.name: Ink Spit
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Special Artillery
attacks.text: You may discard a Special Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It prefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from them before attacking.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

data.name: Poliwag

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage times the amount of Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It's still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.

data.name: Gastly

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Energy Conversion
attacks.text: Put up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand. Gastly does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A mysterious Pokémon. Some say it is a lifeform from another dimension, while other believe it is formed from smog.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Charmeleon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Charmeleon.

data.name: Starmie δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Metal type.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Carracosta

abilities.name: Solid Rock
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 50 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.

data.name: Ninjask

abilities.name: Molting
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put a Shedinja from your discard pile onto your Bench.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: Because it moves so quickly, it sometimes becomes unseeable. It congregates around tree sap.

attacks.name: Night Song
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Shellder

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.

data.name: Beartic

attacks.name: Igloo Hold
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Mountain Drop
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.

data.name: Electabuzz

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electabuzz.

data.flavorText: Its body constantly discharges electricity. Getting close to it will make your hair stand on end.

data.name: Helioptile

attacks.name: Destructive Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

data.name: Buizel
data.flavorText: It swims by rotating its two tails like a screw. When it dives, its flotation sac collapses.

data.name: Victreebel

attacks.name: Lure
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Acid
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

abilities.name: Erasing Sound
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Deoxys Attack Forme

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Attack Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Attack Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys Attack Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Psychic Boost
attacks.text: During your next turn, Deoxys's Psychic Boost attack's base damage is 20.

data.flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its cell composition is similar to water molecules. As a result, it can melt away into water.

data.name: Poliwrath

attacks.name: Dashing Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was on the Bench and became your Active Pokémon this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: An adept swimmer, it knows the front crawl, butterfly, and more. It is faster than the best human swimmers.

data.name: Torkoal

attacks.name: Flaming Honk
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fire Energy cards, attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: If the fire burning within its shell goes out, it will die. Those who wish to raise one in their home must always keep something flammable at hand.

abilities.name: Gluey Slime
abilities.text: As long as Ariados is in play, each player must pay an additional Colorless to retreat his or her Active Pokémon. Gluey Slime can't make a player pay more than an additional Colorless to retreat a Pokémon, even if there is more than 1 Ariados in play.

attacks.name: Spider Force
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, this attack does 20 damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Beat Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each of your Pokémon in play (including this one). This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it suddenly extends the claws and startles its enemy.

data.name: Swirlix

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

data.name: Pikachu & Zekrom-GX
rules: TAG TEAM rule: When your TAG TEAM is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Full Blitz
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Lightning Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Tag Bolt-GX
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra Lightning Energy attached to it (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 170 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: Their numbers seem to have rapidly increased in Alola. Custom has it that houses where Snorunt live will be prosperous for generations to come.

data.name: Suicune

attacks.name: Sheer Cold
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Said to be the embodiment of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

data.name: Dark Ariados
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Breaking Impact
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Magcargo

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its body is as hot as lava and is always billowing. Flames will occasionally burst from its shell.

data.name: Houndoom

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Until the end of your next turn, if an attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom or this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get the shivers and head straight back to their nests.

abilities.name: Clear Body
abilities.text: Registeel can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Volcanion

attacks.name: Flare Starter
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you go second and it's your first turn, instead search for up to 3 Fire Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: High-Heat Blast
attacks.text: If you have at least 4 Fire Energy in play, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

data.name: Piplup
data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

data.name: Spoink

attacks.name: Rocket Jump
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It bounces around on its tail to keep its heart pumping. It carries a pearl from Clamperl on its head.

abilities.name: Dig Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Quagsire from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Pump Out
attacks.text: If Quagsire has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Mirror Move
attacks.text: If Pidgeot was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to Pidgeot to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: By flapping its wings with all its might, PIDGEOT can make a gust of wind capable of bending tall trees.

data.name: Surfing Pikachu
data.flavorText: One summer, a group of Pikachus was found riding the waves at the local beach.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: When battling opponents, it sprays fire from its five horns. The max temperature of the flames can reach nearly 5,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Keystone Seal
abilities.text: As long as Spiritomb is your Active Pokémon, each player can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Darkness Grace
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) If you do, put 1 damage counter on Spiritomb. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Sonicboom
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Pokémon on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Magneton does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Formed by several Magnemites linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up.

data.name: Pichu
rules: If your Active Pokémon is a Baby Pokémon and your opponent announces an attack, your opponent flips a coin (before doing anything else). If tails, your opponent's turn ends.

attacks.name: Energy Patch
attacks.text: Take a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to another of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 60 more damage. If not, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

abilities.name: Burning Mane
abilities.text: If Rapidash is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Rapidash is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Shooting Fire
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Rapidash and choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Tympole

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

data.name: Goldeen

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its dorsal, pectoral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.

abilities.name: Carefree
abilities.text: Grumpig can't be Confused.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

data.name: Phione

abilities.name: Murmurs of the Sea
abilities.text: Your Water Pokémon can't be Confused. If those Pokémon are already Confused, remove that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

abilities.name: Icy Aura
abilities.text: As long as Mamoswine GL is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each Active Pokémon (excluding Water Pokémon) (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Darkrai

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Deep Wind
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 60 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It chases people and Pokémon from its territory by causing them to experience deep, nightmarish slumbers.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of Energy attached to Starmie and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Star Back
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Jynx

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Merely by meditating, the Pokémon launches a powerful psychic energy attack.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

data.name: Purrloin

attacks.name: Knock Off
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

abilities.name: Natural Remedy
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Swampert, remove 1 damage counter from Swampert.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Camerupt

attacks.name: Strong Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The volcanoes on its back have a major eruption every 10 years—or whenever it becomes really angry.

data.name: Flapple

abilities.name: Apple Drop
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If you placed any damage counters in this way, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It ate a sour apple, and that induced its evolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid capable of causing chemical burns.

data.name: Clauncher

attacks.name: Double Pincers
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Through controlled expulsions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.

data.name: Psyduck

attacks.name: Firefighting
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When headaches stimulate its brain cells, which are usually inactive, it can use a mysterious power.

data.name: Prinplup

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Mew
data.flavorText: Because it can use all kinds of moves, many scientists believe Mew to be the ancestor of Pokémon.

data.name: Ninetales

attacks.name: Hex
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

abilities.name: Deep Sleep
abilities.text: As long as Relicanth is your Active Pokémon, a player flips 2 coins for each of his or her Pokémon that is Asleep between turns. If either coin is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Basculin

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Final Gambit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this Pokémon does 80 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they'll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

abilities.name: Magnetic Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Metal Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beldum is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Metal Charge
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on Beldum.

data.name: Seadra

attacks.name: Knockout Needle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It is capable of swimming backwards by rapidly flapping its winglike pectoral fins and stout tail.

data.name: Jolteon

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Jolteon during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Detonate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Brock's Graveler does 50 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Xatu

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Stressful Eye
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard a Trainer card you find there.

data.flavorText: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

data.name: Team Magma's Zangoose

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Team Magma Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Play
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Team Magma Pokémon on your Bench.

data.flavorText: Can you handle the formation attack of the fearless Zangoose?

data.name: Luxray

attacks.name: Raid
attacks.text: If this Pokémon evolved from Luxio during this turn, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

data.name: Lairon

attacks.name: Scrap Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Lairon.

data.flavorText: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Rain Castform, or Sunny Castform and switch it with Snow-cloud Castform. (Any cards attached to Snow-cloud Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Snow-cloud Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Flurries
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: White Snow
attacks.text: If Magnetic Storm is in play, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Flaaffy

attacks.name: Tail Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Its fluffy fleece easily stores electricity. Its rubbery hide keeps it from being electrocuted.

data.name: Grumpig

attacks.name: Head Walking
attacks.text: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto his or her Bench. Then, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Knock Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It uses black pearls to amplify its psychic power. It does an odd dance to gain control over foes.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Light
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Dark Dragonair is your Active Pokémon, you may search your deck for an Evolution card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonair is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Dewott

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

data.name: Poliwhirl

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it's safe.

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Clamp Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

data.name: Amaura

attacks.name: Powder Snow
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

data.name: Glalie

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Floe
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.flavorText: Legend says a boulder on an icy mountain absorbed the distress and regrets of a stranded mountaineer, giving rise to Glalie.

attacks.name: Toss
attacks.text: You may discard from your hand as many Technical Machine and Pokémon Tool cards as you like. This attack does 30 damage times the number of cards you discarded.

data.name: Seaking

attacks.name: Soaking Horn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It makes its nest by hollowing out boulders in streams with its horn. It defends its eggs with its life.

data.name: Slowbro-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Slack Off
attacks.text: Heal 60 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.name: Golduck

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It is seen swimming dynamically and elegantly using its well-developed limbs and flippers.

data.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Clamp Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spike Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

data.name: Aipom

attacks.name: Pilfer
attacks.text: Shuffle Aipom and all cards attached to it into your deck. Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.

abilities.name: Beating Wings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Pidgeot is your Active Pokémon, you may shuffle 1 of your Benched Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power can't be used if Pidgeot is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Sharp Beak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Cubchoo

attacks.name: Sniffle
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Belt attack's base damage is 40.

data.flavorText: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

data.name: Corphish
data.flavorText: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.

data.name: Clawitzer

abilities.name: Mega Boost
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Special Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Mega Evolution Pokémon.

data.flavorText: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jynx from your hand onto Smoochum (this counts as evolving Smoochum) and remove all damage counters from Smoochum.

attacks.name: Blown Kiss
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Mesprit

abilities.name: Mental Shroud
abilities.text: If you have Uxie and Azelf in play, each of your Pokémon has no Weakness.

data.flavorText: When Mesprit flew, people learned the joy and sadness of living. It was the birth of emotions.

data.name: Basculin

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.

data.name: Electrode

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may do 40 damage plus 60 more damage. If you do, discard all Lightning Energy attached to Electrode.

data.flavorText: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.

data.name: Staryu

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It appears in large numbers by seashores. At night, its central core flashes with a red light.

data.name: Oricorio

attacks.name: Captivating Salsa
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

data.flavorText: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If Relicanth has any Water Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Relicanth is 0.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.name: Chansey

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Egg Toss
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It holds its egg carefully when moving so as not to break it. Still, it is fast enough to disappear in the blink of an eye.

data.name: Farfetch'd
data.flavorText: The plant stalk it holds is its weapon. The stalk is used like a sword to cut all sorts of things.

data.name: Litten

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

data.name: Heatran-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Burning Road
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to become your Active Pokémon, you may move any number of Fire Energy from your other Pokémon to it.

attacks.name: Hot Burn-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Scram
abilities.text: If Brock's Primeape ever has exactly 10 HP left, shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power stops working while Brock's Primeape is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Thrash
attacks.text: Brock's Primeape does 20 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Deoxys Defense Forme

abilities.name: Form Change
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for any Deoxys and switch it with Deoxys Defense Forme. (Any cards attached to Deoxys Defense Forme, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Deoxys Defense Forme on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Form Change Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Psychic Defense
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of an attack, and any damage done to Deoxys by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: An alien virus that fell to earth on a meteor underwent a DNA mutation to become this Pokémon.

data.name: Lickilicky

attacks.name: Harrumph
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The long tongue is always soggy with slobber. The saliva contains a solvent that causes numbness.

data.name: Palpitoad

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, the can make wave in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

data.name: Blissey

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Blissey.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Blissey does 40 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Anyone who takes even one taste of Blissey's egg becomes unfailingly caring and pleasant to everyone.

data.name: Honchkrow

abilities.name: Darkness Restore
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Honchkrow is your Active Pokémon and your opponent's Bench isn't full, you may use this power. Search your opponent's discard pile for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto his or her bench. This power can't be used if Honchkrow is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Riot
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon that isn't an evolved Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's).

data.flavorText: If one utters a deep cry, many Murkrow gather quickly. For this, it is called "Summoner of Night."

abilities.name: Bubble Turn
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Azumarill is on your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, return Azumarill and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance.

attacks.name: Magic Heal
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Remove a number of damage counters equal to the number of heads from your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Mr. Mime E4 by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Glalie

abilities.name: Craggy Face
abilities.text: As long as Glalie is your Active Pokémon, any damage done by attacks from your opponent's Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Intimidation Pebble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards or Supporter cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: To protect itself, it clads its body in an armor of ice, made by freezing moisture in the air.

data.name: Vanillite

attacks.name: Icicle Barb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

data.name: Alolan Ninetales

abilities.name: Luminous Barrier
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Pokémon-GX or Pokémon-EX.

data.flavorText: It creates drops of ice in its coat and showers them over its enemies. Anyone who angers it will be frozen stiff in an instant.

data.name: Zorua
data.flavorText: It changes so it looks like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.

data.name: Geodude
data.flavorText: Geodude that have lived a long life have had all their edges smoothed out until they're totally round. They also have a calm, quiet disposition.

data.name: Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Hidden Poison
abilities.text: If Roserade is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Roserade is Knocked Out), the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bowed Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deep Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Shellder

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: Clamping on to an opponent reveals its vulnerable parts, so it uses this move only as a last resort.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

data.name: Wishiwashi

abilities.name: Meet Up
abilities.text: Your Wishiwashi-GX in play get +20 HP, and their attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It's awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.

data.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Porygon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Version Update
attacks.text: Search your deck for Porygon2, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.flavorText: It is a manmade Pokémon. Since it doesn't breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment..

data.name: Floatzel

attacks.name: Aqua Bomb
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

attacks.name: Psymist
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, choose 1 of you opponent's Pokémon and put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that already has damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

data.name: Minun

attacks.name: (+) Spark
attacks.text: If Plusle is on your Bench, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

data.name: Ekans
data.flavorText: The eggs of bird Pokémon are its favorite food. It swallows eggs whole, so sometimes an egg gets stuck, and Ekans faints.

data.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.flavorText: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

attacks.name: Mysterious Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Pod
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Pokémon named Tentacool, Tentacruel, Misty's Tentacool, and/or Misty's Tentacruel. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Emboar

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

attacks.name: Metal Load
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Metal Energy card and attach it to Metang.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Wobbuffet by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Flip Over
attacks.text: Wobbuffet does 10 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

data.name: Volcarona-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Flaming Shot
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Fire Energy card from your hand. If you do, put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Backfire
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

attacks.name: Massive Heat Wave-GX
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from each of your opponent's Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

abilities.name: Rare Metal
abilities.text: All basic Energy cards attached to Steelix provide Metal Energy instead of their usual types.

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Metal Tail
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 80 damage. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Cryogonal

attacks.name: Call Sign
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Cryofreeze
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148° F.

abilities.name: Aqua Lift
abilities.text: If Lombre has any Water Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Lombre is 0.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Confusion Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poison Smog
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Primeape

abilities.name: Anger Point
abilities.text: If Primeape has any damage counters on it, Primeape's attacks do 40 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Whump
attacks.text: Primeape is now Confused. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It grows angry if you see its eyes and gets angrier if you run. If you beat it, it gets even madder.

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

data.name: Plusle

abilities.name: Plus Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't use more than 1 Plus Charge Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Plusle is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Tag Play +
attacks.text: If you have Minun on your Bench, you may do 20 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

data.name: Ludicolo

abilities.name: Rain Dish
abilities.text: At any times between turns, heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Groovy Dance
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.

data.name: Combee

attacks.name: Bee March
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Combee and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

data.name: Raboot

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

data.name: Munchlax

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attacks.name: Heave
attacks.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, this attack does nothing.) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.

data.name: Talonflame V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fast Flight
attacks.text: If you go first, you can use this attack during your first turn. Discard your hand and draw 6 cards.

attacks.name: Bright Wing
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Parabolic Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

data.name: Magnezone

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Magnet Slash
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to Magnezone.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

data.name: Helioptile

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

abilities.name: Temperamental Weather
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Castform, Rain Castform, or Snow-cloud Castform and switch it with Sunny Castform. (Any cards attached to Sunny Castform, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) Shuffle Sunny Castform back into your deck. You can't use more than 1 Temperamental Weather Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Holon Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Snorlax

attacks.name: Layabout
attacks.text: Remove all damage counters from Snorlax. Snorlax can't use Layabout during your next turn.

attacks.name: Clomp Clomp Clobber
attacks.text: Put 1 Energy card attached to Snorlax in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: Its stomach's digestive juices can dissolve any kind of poison. It can even eat things off the ground.

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Mean Look
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It can drink more than 10 ounces of blood at once. If it has too much, it gets heavy and flies clumsily.

data.name: Alolan Geodude

attacks.name: Self-Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 60 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: If you mistake it for a rock and step on it, it will headbutt you in anger. In addition to the pain, it will also zap you with a shock.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Graveler by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Golbat

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: Remove a number of damage counters from Golbat equal to the damage done to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). If Golbat has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

data.flavorText: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly.

data.name: Marill

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Marill but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.flavorText: The tip of its tail, which contains oil that is lighter than water, lets it swim without drowning.

data.name: Shiftry

attacks.name: Whisk Away
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a Pokémon you find there and put it on the bottom your opponent's deck. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Spirit Dance
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe's mind and take preemptive action.

data.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Arcanine in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Arcanine does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that has been long admired for its beauty. It runs gracefully, as if on wings.

data.name: Ninetales V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Nine-Tailed Shapeshifter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Active Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Baltoy

ancientTrait.name: θ Stop
ancientTrait.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Future Spin
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

data.flavorText: It moves by spinning on its foot. It is a rare Pokémon that was discovered in ancient ruins.

data.name: Kadabra

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard 1 Psychic Energy card attached to Kadabra in order to use this attack. Remove all damage counters from Kadabra.

data.flavorText: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches even to those just nearby.

data.name: Houndour

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Collect Fire
attacks.text: If there are any Fire Energy cards in your discard pile, choose 1 of them and attach it to Houndour.

data.flavorText: To corner prey, they check each other's location using barks that only they can understand.

data.name: Aqua Diffuser
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
The Team Aqua Pokémon this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Aqua Diffuser
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Shuppet

attacks.name: Bleh
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It loves vengeful emotions and hangs in rows under the eaves of houses where vengeful people live.

data.name: Empoleon

attacks.name: Emperor's Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.flavorText: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.

data.name: Bronzong

attacks.name: Wide Laser
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Charmeleon does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Dark Slowbro

abilities.name: Reel In
abilities.text: When you play Dark Slowbro from your hand, choose up to 3 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards from your discard pile and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Fickle Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: It loves nothing better than to be left alone, and so sometimes ends up being manipulated by unscrupulous people.

abilities.name: Leaf Ride
abilities.text: If Scyther has any Energy attached to it, Scyther's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.name: Haunter

attacks.name: Sneaky Placement
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

attacks.name: Clay Curse
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Clay Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: When they're young, they live with a pride. Once they're able to hunt prey on their own, they're kicked out and have to make their own way.

data.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Control
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokémon of your choice.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.flavorText: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

data.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Irongrip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing its victim around and toss it hard.

data.name: Arbok
data.flavorText: After stunning its opponents with the pattern on its stomach, it quickly wraps them up in its body and waits for them to stop moving.

data.name: Ducklett

attacks.name: Roost
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon can't retreat during your next turn.

data.flavorText: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.

abilities.name: Restless Sleep
abilities.text: If your opponent's attack does damage to Rocket's Snorlax and Rocket's Snorlax is already Asleep (even if it's Knocked Out), this power does 20 damage to the attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Rocket's Snorlax is now Asleep (after doing damage).

data.name: Gyarados

abilities.name: Dragon DNA
abilities.text: Gyarados can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.) If Gyarados uses any attack from its Basic Pokémon, that attack does 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Enrage
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it. If the first coin is tails, Gyarados is now Confused.

data.flavorText: Once it appears, its rage never settles until it has razed the fields and mountains around it.

attacks.name: Licking-Licking Heal
attacks.text: Attach a Basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, remove 2 damage counters from that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Vaporeon

abilities.name: Torrential Awakening
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Memory Capsule attached, Fire Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities.

data.flavorText: When Vaporeon's fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

data.name: Beartic

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attack from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

data.name: Litten

attacks.name: Caturday
attacks.text: Draw a card. If you do, this Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: If you try too hard to get close to it, it won't open up to you. Even if you do grow close, giving it too much affection is still a no-no.

data.name: Coalossal

abilities.name: Tar Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Fire Energy card, a Fighting Energy card, or 1 of each from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

data.flavorText: It's usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines enrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with flames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
